org.apache.juneau.rest

Class RestRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper
        • org.apache.juneau.rest.RestRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest, javax.servlet.ServletRequest

    public final class RestRequest
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper
    Represents an HTTP request for a REST resource.

    Equivalent to HttpServletRequest except with some additional convenience methods.

    For reference, given the URL "http://localhost:9080/contextRoot/servletPath/foo?bar=baz#qux", the following methods return the following values....

    MethodValue
    getContextPath()/contextRoot
    getPathInfo()/foo
    getPathTranslated()path-to-deployed-war-on-filesystem/foo
    getQueryString()bar=baz
    getRequestURI()/contextRoot/servletPath/foo
    getRequestURL()http://localhost:9080/contextRoot/servletPath/foo
    getServletPath()/servletPath

    Refer to REST Servlet API for information about using this class.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest

        BASIC_AUTH, CLIENT_CERT_AUTH, DIGEST_AUTH, FORM_AUTH

      • getDescription

      • getAttribute

        public Object getAttribute(String name,
                           Object def)
        Same as ServletRequestWrapper.getAttribute(String) but returns a default value if not found.
        Parameters:
        name - The request attribute name.
        def - The default value if the attribute doesn't exist.
        Returns:
        The request attribute value.

      • attr

        public RestRequest attr(String name,
                        Object value)
        Shorthand method for calling ServletRequestWrapper.setAttribute(String, Object) fluently.
        Parameters:
        name - The request attribute name.
        value - The request attribute value.
        Returns:
        This object (for method chaining).

      • resolveProperty

        public Object resolveProperty(org.apache.juneau.rest.CallMethod cm,
                              String category,
                              String name)
        Resolves the specified property.
        Parameters:
        cm - The CallMethod object where the HtmlDocSerializer settings are defined. Optional value. If not specified, then won't resolve HtmlDocSerializer properties.
        category - The property category. The possible values are:
        • "Attribute" - Value returned by ServletRequest.getAttribute(String).
        • "FormData" - Value returned by getFormData(String).
        • "Header" - Value returned by getHeader(String).
        • "HtmlDocSerializer"
          Valid names:
          • "aside" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_aside
          • "footer" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_footer
          • "header" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_header
          • "navlinks.list" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_navlinks
          • "nav" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_nav
          • "noResultsMessage" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_noResultsMessage
          • "nowrap" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_nowrap
          • "script.list" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_script
          • "style.list" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_style
          • "stylesheet" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_stylesheet
          • "template" - See HtmlDocSerializer.HTMLDOC_template
        • "Path" - Value returned by getPath(String).
        • "Query" = Value returned by getQuery(String).
        • "Request"
          Valid names:
          • "contextPath" - Value returned by getContextPath()
          • "method" - Value returned by getMethod()
          • "methodDescription" - Value returned by getMethodDescription()
          • "methodSummary" - Value returned by getMethodSummary()
          • "pathInfo" - Value returned by HttpServletRequestWrapper.getPathInfo()
          • "requestParentURI" - Value returned by UriContext.getRootRelativePathInfoParent()
          • "requestURI" - Value returned by HttpServletRequestWrapper.getRequestURI()
          • "servletClass" - The class name of the servlet
          • "servletClassSimple" - The simple class name of the servlet.
          • "servletDescription" - Value returned by getServletDescription()
          • "servletParentURI" - Value returned by UriContext.getRootRelativeServletPathParent()
          • "servletPath" - See getServletPath()
          • "servletTitle" - See getServletTitle()
          • "servletURI" - See UriContext.getRootRelativeServletPath()
          • "siteName" - See getSiteName()
        name - The property name.
        Returns:
        The resolve property, or null if it wasn't found.

      • getQuery

        public RequestQuery getQuery()
        Equivalent to ServletRequestWrapper.getParameterMap(), but only looks for query parameters in the URL, not form posts.

        This method can be used to retrieve query parameters without triggering the underlying servlet API to load and parse the request body.

        This object is modifiable.

        Returns:
        The query parameters as a modifiable map.

      • getReader

        public BufferedReader getReader()
                         throws IOException
        Returns the HTTP body content as a Reader.

        If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &body=xxx in the URL query string.

        Automatically handles GZipped input streams.

        Specified by:
        getReader in interface javax.servlet.ServletRequest
        Overrides:
        getReader in class javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getInputStream

        public javax.servlet.ServletInputStream getInputStream()
                                                throws IOException
        Returns the HTTP body content as an InputStream.

        Automatically handles GZipped input streams.

        Specified by:
        getInputStream in interface javax.servlet.ServletRequest
        Overrides:
        getInputStream in class javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
        Returns:
        The negotiated input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - If any error occurred while trying to get the input stream or wrap it in the GZIP wrapper.

      • getUriContext

        public UriContext getUriContext()
        Returns the URI context of the request.

        The URI context contains all the information about the URI of the request, such as the servlet URI, context path, etc...

        Returns:
        The URI context of the request.

      • getUriResolver

        public UriResolver getUriResolver(UriResolution resolution,
                                  UriRelativity relativity)
        Returns a URI resolver that can be used to convert URIs to absolute or root-relative form.
        Parameters:
        resolution - The URI resolution rule.
        relativity - The relative URI relativity rule.
        Returns:
        The URI resolver for this request.

      • getUriResolver

        public UriResolver getUriResolver()
        Shortcut for calling getUriResolver() using UriResolution.ROOT_RELATIVE and UriRelativity.RESOURCE
        Returns:
        The URI resolver for this request.

      • getUri

        public URI getUri(boolean includeQuery,
                  Map<String,?> addQueryParams)
        Returns the URI for this request.

        Similar to HttpServletRequestWrapper.getRequestURI() but returns the value as a URI. It also gives you the capability to override the query parameters (e.g. add new query parameters to the existing URI).

        Parameters:
        includeQuery - If true include the query parameters on the request.
        addQueryParams - Augment the request URI with the specified query parameters.
        Returns:
        A new URI.

      • getSiteName

        public String getSiteName()
        Returns the localized site name.

        The site name is intended to be a title that can be applied to the entire site.

        One possible use is if you want to add the same title to the top of all pages by defining a header on a common parent class like so:

        htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( header={ "<h1>$R{siteName}</h1>", "<h2>$R{servletTitle}</h2>" } )

        Equivalent to calling RestInfoProvider.getSiteName(RestRequest) with this object.

        Returns:
        The localized servlet label.

      • getServletTitle

        public String getServletTitle()
        Returns the localized servlet title.

        Equivalent to calling RestInfoProvider.getTitle(RestRequest) with this object.

        Returns:
        The localized servlet label.

      • getServletDescription

        public String getServletDescription()
        Returns the localized servlet description.

        Equivalent to calling RestInfoProvider.getDescription(RestRequest) with this object.

        Returns:
        The localized servlet description.

      • getMethodSummary

        public String getMethodSummary()
        Returns the localized method summary.

        Equivalent to calling RestInfoProvider.getMethodSummary(String, RestRequest) with this object.

        Returns:
        The localized method description.

        public String getMethod()

        If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &method=xxx in the URL query string.

        Overrides:
        getMethod in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper

      • getHttpMethod

        public HttpMethod getHttpMethod()
        Returns the HTTP 1.1 method name of the request as an enum.

        Note that non-RFC2616 method names resolve as HttpMethod.OTHER.

        Returns:
        The HTTP method.

      • isPlainText

        public boolean isPlainText()
        Returns true if &plainText=true was specified as a URL parameter.

        This indicates that the Content-Type of the output should always be set to "text/plain" to make it easy to render in a browser.

        This feature is useful for debugging.

        Returns:
        true if &amp;plainText=true was specified as a URL parameter

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(String key,
                         Object... args)
        Shortcut method for calling MessageBundle.getString(Locale, String, Object...) based on the request locale.
        Parameters:
        key - The message key.
        args - Optional MessageFormat-style arguments.
        Returns:
        The localized message.

      • getResourceBundle

        public MessageBundle getResourceBundle()
        Returns the resource bundle for the request locale.
        Returns:
        The resource bundle. Never null.

      • getContext

        public RestContext getContext()
        Returns the servlet handling the request.

        Can be used to access servlet-init parameters or annotations during requests, such as in calls to RestGuard.guard(RestRequest, RestResponse)..

        Returns:
        The servlet handling the request.

      • getJavaMethod

        public Method getJavaMethod()
        Returns the java method handling the request.

        Can be used to access the method name or method annotations during requests, such as in calls to RestGuard.guard(RestRequest, RestResponse).

        Notes:
        • This returns null when evaluating servlet-level guards since the method has not been resolved at that point of execution.
        Returns:
        The Java method handling the request, or null if the method has not yet been resolved.

      • getBeanSession

        public BeanSession getBeanSession()
        Returns the BeanSession associated with this request.
        Returns:
        The request bean session.

      • getVarResolverSession

        public VarResolverSession getVarResolverSession()
        Returns the variable resolver session for this request using session objects created by RestCallHandler.getSessionObjects(RestRequest).

        See RestContext.getVarResolver() for the list of supported variables.

        Returns:
        The variable resolver for this request.

      • resolveVars

        public String resolveVars(String input)
        Shortcut for calling getVarResolverSession().resolve(input).
        Parameters:
        input - The input string to resolve variables in.
        Returns:
        The string with variables resolved, or null if input is null.

      • resolveVars

        public String[] resolveVars(String[] input)
        Shortcut for calling resolveVars(String[]) on all elements in the array.
        Parameters:
        input - The input strings to resolve variables in.
        Returns:
        A copy of the array with variables resolved.

      • getReaderResource

        public ReaderResource getReaderResource(String name,
                                        boolean resolveVars,
                                        MediaType mediaType)
                                 throws IOException
        Returns an instance of a ReaderResource that represents the contents of a resource text file from the classpath.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        resolveVars - If true, any Parameter variables will be resolved by the variable resolver returned by getVarResolverSession().
        See RestContext.getVarResolver() for the list of supported variables.
        mediaType - The value to set as the "Content-Type" header for this object.
        Returns:
        A new reader resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getReaderResource

        public ReaderResource getReaderResource(String name,
                                        boolean resolveVars)
                                 throws IOException
        Same as getReaderResource(String, boolean, MediaType) except uses the resource mime-type map constructed using RestConfig.addMimeTypes(String...) to determine the media type.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        resolveVars - If true, any Parameter variables will be resolved by the variable resolver returned by getVarResolverSession().
        See RestContext.getVarResolver() for the list of supported variables.
        Returns:
        A new reader resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getReaderResource

        public ReaderResource getReaderResource(String name)
                                 throws IOException
        Same as getReaderResource(String, boolean) with resolveVars == false
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        Returns:
        A new reader resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

        public ConfigFile getConfigFile()
        Returns the config file associated with the servlet.

      • getSwaggerFromFile

        protected Swagger getSwaggerFromFile()
        Returns the localized Swagger from the file system.

        Looks for a file called "{ServletClass}_{locale}.json" in the same package as this servlet and returns it as a parsed Swagger object.

        Returned objects are cached for later quick-lookup.

        Returns:
        The parsed swagger object, or null if the swagger file could not be found.

        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
